text: Pendle Beer Festival 2016. Copper-amber in colour. Has a light fruitiness but is extremely thin tasting. Useful if you are driving I guess.

Bottle 500ml (AbM)
Copper color, small off-white head, some lace. Aroma is nutty, a bit caramalt and yeast. Light-bodied. Nutty, caramelly, English hoppy. Grapefruity-piney hops in the finish. Quite tasty for this ABV, of course slifghtly empty.
Bottle at Yesprs - Thanks. Clear golden - white head. Red berries, fruity, youghurt, grape fruits, soapy, ok bitterness, light tropical, light to medium carbonation.

Cask at The Merchants, Rugby.
Think may be my first low ABV beer (that I can remember!)
Poured a chestnut brown with a white head, malty biscuits and a bitter tang, but a semi watery finish. Not bad really but not worth a second...
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty caramel aroma. Fruity malty spicy caramel and weak hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty caramel finish.

Bottled. Light amber coloured. unclear. Small off white head. Aroma. Sweetness, caramel, herbs. Flavour. Tropical fruits, sweetness, herbs. Thin bodied. Ends herbal bittter. Quite nice for a low alc. beer.
Bottle at Jespers. Pours a clear golden with a small white head. Dry with a light sweetness. Aromas of earthy hopso. Medium to light bodied. Medium carbonation. Bitter finish.
50 cl. bottle. Amber colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops and some bitterness.

Bottle at yespr
Clear amber colored with a small white head
Sweet and caramel and spices with notes of spices.
Sweet and fruity flavor of caramel and hops.
Hoppy finish.
Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of straw and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw and cardboard, leading to a dry finish.
50 cl bottle. Pours cloudy orange with a small white head. Aroma is peachy and light grapefruity. Toasted and bitter. Dry and slight herbal. Toasted finish.

Cask at Orpington Liberal Club, deep brown with a tihn head, nose is citrus hoppy with light marmalade and apple, body is properly dry and bitter, with roasty malt and a nutty edge, before a done-dry toasted citrus bitter finish. Excellent.

First venture into low ABV beers. This was a pleasant surprise. The lower markings can be attributed to its innate introversion. Low ABV (LAB) beers arent going to assault the palate or provide seminal flavors. What this does do, is assuage the fear that LABs are thin-bodied and bereft of discernible flavors. The body here is light but enhanced by jubilant carbonation. It has beautiful balance in both the nose and taste between caramel and light citrus/earthy hop flavor. I would prefer the earthy, spicy notes were reigned in but thats personal preference. 
The best sub-3 beer I have had.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr fruchtig, hopfig, bitter. Geschmack leicht wässrig fruchtig, bitter, hopfig, Zitrone.

Bottle from Alesbymail. Hazy amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 170314
Cask at the Manchester beer festival... Copper... Thin white head... Sogt dry zezty malt nose... Sift woddy roast.. Dry bitter

Cask at Belfast beer festival 2013
Pale amber, pithy citrys aroma. Medium body but a bit watery flavour wise, the bitterness is there and balancing malt but not enough flavour to carry it

Bottled (from Ales By Mail). Ambery pale brown colour, mediumsized beige head. Aroma is floral, citrus and some mild bready notes. Flavour is citrus, some wood, mild nuttyness as well as some mild caramel malts. Thin in palate, but for being only 2,5 % its rather tasty.

Gravity dispense at Merton Winter BF 13. 
Hazed golden amber with a frothy white head.
Nose carries orange, citrus, peach, hops.
Taste comprises light caramel tones, citrus, orange, hops.
Light to medium in body, but not at all watery,  with soft carbonation leading to a dry and slightly bitter finish.
A more than decent low ABV beer - one of the better ones in its class!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Cask conditioned at Merton Winter Beer Fest 13. Copper with cream head. Crisp dry bitter with quite a zesty hop flavour, some grassy notes. Ok, a little thin, but this is to be expected really but the hops more than compensate. Long citric finish. Good stuff.

Cask (handpump) @ The Rake, 14 Winchester Walk, London, Greater London, England SE1 9AG.Unclear - hazy matt medium yellow - orange amber colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, caramel, moderate to light heavy hoppy, orange - citrus, grapefruit. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, hoppy, sharp. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120115]
Mid copper coloured beer with an off white head. Strong hoppy aroma, fruity and grassy. Dry mouthfeel, hops abound, dry grassy and citrus fruit flavour with a background of malt. Cambridge B.F. 2012
14th July 2011Chelmsford Beer Festival. Hazy brown beer, good pale tan head. Light semi dry palate. Good marmalade orange hops. Light semi dry finish. Nice fresh hops.
